snippet: Little appetite for intervention from a country still weary from two wars and struggling with its own immigration problems.
abstract: Pleas for more aggressive American-led efforts at relieving Syria's humanitarian crisis seem increasingly futile as United States continues to struggle with its own immigration problems; Congress has demonstrated clear lack of political will to intervene directly in what has become full-blown migrant crisis in Europe.
lead_paragraph: Little appetite for intervention from a country still weary from two wars and struggling with its own immigration problems.

headline.main: Many Obstacles Are Seen to U.S. Taking in Large Number of Syrian Refugees
headline.print_headline: Many Obstacles Are Seen to U.S. Taking in Large Number of Syrian Refugees

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Middle East and Africa Migrant Crisis
